channel.title: FroyoScape's Property Concept
channel.description:
[center][size=24pt][tt]FroyoScape's[/tt] Property Concept[/size][/center]
[center][img]http://s3.amazonaws.com/rapgenius/1306852881_deed.gif[/img][/center]
Here's something that stands out. Here is the idea I was planning on keeping my secret. Here is an idea I thought I'd never make. Here is an idea that I have been thinking about ever since mid 2010.
Property. The people of FroyoScape may buy houses and have limits on how many they can buy. Due to FroyoScape striving to have a stable eco, the prices will probably be less that 5 mil.
The thought limit of buying houses: [b]2[/b] The thought limit of buying castles: [b]1[/b] The thought limit of buying miscellaneous places: [b]1[/b]
Yes, you can buy castles. Here, in this all-in-one thread shwoing every single point of this property concept, I will show all (if not, most of them) properties that will be able to be sold and the prices. I will also provide the name of the city that you may buy it at, and also how much increased gp it will be if the player is not born in the city they buy it from.
So, here is the process.
First, the player may request from the NPC who sells property. The request can take from 1 day to even 2 weeks, depending on 2 factors:
[ol][li]The rivalry between the city the player was born in (If he or she is non-native from the city he is buying property from)[/li] [li]How much combat level he or she has.[/li][/ol]
If both are a lot, then expect a faster delivery in response. If not, good luck.
Benefits of the three types of property you can get: [u][b]Houses[/b][/u] Houses are the majority of the property that is sold. Houses don't have any extra rights, but if you get a big house, then you get da respect! You must pay occasional home taxes and they will depend on the size of your house.
Average house tax: [b]2k[/b]
[u][b]Castles[/b][/u] Castles are probably the best thing you can buy. Once you buy a castle, you get other people's taxes! You can save up to get 2 houses after you get a castle!
Average income of castle: [b]5k[/b]
[u][b]Misc. (Such as the party room, the park)[/b][/u] Miscellaneous things just make you look cool. However, you can make people PAY you to see inside. This is especially useful for things such as the party room, where you can charge people an entry fee to enter the party room.
So, let's begin the list of the properties. Here we go!
[img]http://i.imgur.com/oAgGvqh.png[/img]
Location: Lumbridge Swamp Price: 50k
[img]http://i.imgur.com/J2MaFRo.png[/img]
Location: Lumbridge Swamp Price: 60k
[img]http://i.imgur.com/Y39rxEV.png[/img]
Location: Rimmington Price: 100k
[img]http://i.imgur.com/z2K6Xtz.png[/img] [b]Yes, even the grain place.[/b]
Location: Draynor-Lumbridge border Price: 500k
[img]http://i.imgur.com/8WFhldR.png[/img]
Location: Draynor Price: 50k
[img]http://i.imgur.com/PQbN3GL.png[/img]
Location: Falador Price: 20k
[img]http://i.imgur.com/Oi0SMUD.png[/img]
Location: Falador Price: 300k
[img]http://i.imgur.com/UTUq7d6.png[/img]
Location: Falador Price: 2M
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/UTUq7d6.png[/img]
Location: Falador Price: 5M Read about castles to find the specialty of getting one!
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/dH5pbuT.png[/img]
Location: Edgeville-Varrock Border Price: 80k
[b]More to be mentioned![/b]

item.title: FroyoScape's Property Concept
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Null Amount:

There should be a maximum amount a player can charge to use their property. (e.g. a maximum of 250 coins for a player to enter the party room.)

Didn’t think of that.

Clawz fury:

just a question, why are you openly posting all your ideas for everyone to steal

I’m only posting public ideas.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:

There should be a maximum amount a player can charge to use their property. (e.g. a maximum of 250 coins for a player to enter the party room.)

item.title: FroyoScape's Property Concept
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Int Bauk, post:21, topic:478898”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=597117.msg4205739#msg4205739 date=1358900139]

i like the idea, but the prices are too low.

also, another idea would be that: say if you bought varrock, and you had thieving stalls there, people would have to pay to use for the stalls for x amount of time and you receive income.

TLDR; if people use resources in your bought location, you receive income.

You may not buy towns. That’s what the government is for. There is a president, a vice president, a mayor, and an average citizen.

Here’s what I’m thinking atm:
Citizens may own their own shops.
[/quote]

didn’t read it

i like the idea, but the prices are too low.

We aren’t a PI server where money is handed to you through monsters that drop max cash. The economy is going to be proportioned, and a good source of income would be putting effort into PvP, minigames, and skilling. Another thing is that gaining money is not going to be tedious work. You will have to work, but not spending hours on end trying to achieve that 1k.

also, another idea would be that: say if you bought varrock, and you had thieving stalls there, people would have to pay to use for the stalls for x amount of time and you receive income.

That sort of defeats the purpose of “thieving,” now, doesn’t it?

TLDR; if people use resources in your bought location, you receive income.

We’ll see about that one.

shut up smarty pants. it was a concept, every concept has a flaw. how does it defeat the purpose of ‘thieving’?, you pay to use the stall (say 10k?) and you receive 3k, however you can use it for x amount of minutes/hours/days/months etcetera. use your mind kid[/quote]
Good point. Hmm, I might add theiving stall places (Such as the one in ardougne) to be buyable.

Read full topic

That sort of defeats the purpose of “thieving,” now, doesn’t it?

TLDR; if people use resources in your bought location, you receive income.

We’ll see about that one.[/quote]

shut up smarty pants. it was a concept, every concept has a flaw. how does it defeat the purpose of ‘thieving’?, you pay to use the stall (say 10k?) and you receive 3k, however you can use it for x amount of minutes/hours/days/months etcetera. use your mind kid

also, another idea would be that: say if you bought varrock, and you had thieving stalls there, people would have to pay to use for the stalls for x amount of time and you receive income.

TLDR; if people use resources in your bought location, you receive income.[/quote]

item.title: FroyoScape's Property Concept
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

i like the idea, but the prices are too low.
We aren't a PI server where money is handed to you through monsters that drop max cash. The economy is going to be proportioned, and a good source of income would be putting effort into PvP, minigames, and skilling. Another thing is that gaining money is not going to be tedious work. You will have to work, but not spending hours on end trying to achieve that 1k.
also, another idea would be that: say if you bought varrock, and you had thieving stalls there, people would have to pay to use for the stalls for x amount of time and you receive income.
That sort of defeats the purpose of "thieving," now, doesn't it? ;)
TLDR; if people use resources in your bought location, you receive income.
We'll see about that one.

Read full topic

item.description:

Remember, Mikey, that this is still a concept. Some discussion will probably take place that includes you having money removed from your bank every week to pay off rent, or that you can rent it off to people in exchange for weekly rent. It is still an idea.

[/quote]

Houses renew every month.
Castles renew every two months.
Misc places renew every week.[/quote]I might not have paid enough attention to your thread but, what are the benefits of the properties?

item.title: FroyoScape's Property Concept
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[center][size=24pt][tt]FroyoScape’s[/tt] Property Concept[/size][/center]

[center][/center]

Here’s something that stands out. Here is the idea I was planning on keeping my secret. Here is an idea I thought I’d never make. Here is an idea that I have been thinking about ever since mid 2010.

Property. The people of FroyoScape may buy houses and have limits on how many they can buy. Due to FroyoScape striving to have a stable eco, the prices will probably be less that 5 mil.

The thought limit of buying houses: 2
The thought limit of buying castles: 1
The thought limit of buying miscellaneous places: 1

Yes, you can buy castles. Here, in this all-in-one thread shwoing every single point of this property concept, I will show all (if not, most of them) properties that will be able to be sold and the prices. I will also provide the name of the city that you may buy it at, and also how much increased gp it will be if the player is not born in the city they buy it from.

So, here is the process.

First, the player may request from the NPC who sells property. The request can take from 1 day to even 2 weeks, depending on 2 factors:

[ol][li]The rivalry between the city the player was born in (If he or she is non-native from the city he is buying property from)[/li]
[li]How much combat level he or she has.[/li][/ol]

If both are a lot, then expect a faster delivery in response. If not, good luck.

Benefits of the three types of property you can get:
Houses
Houses are the majority of the property that is sold. Houses don’t have any extra rights, but if you get a big house, then you get da respect! You must pay occasional home taxes and they will depend on the size of your house.

Average house tax: 2k

Castles
Castles are probably the best thing you can buy. Once you buy a castle, you get other people’s taxes! You can save up to get 2 houses after you get a castle!

Average income of castle: 5k

Misc. (Such as the party room, the park)
Miscellaneous things just make you look cool. However, you can make people PAY you to see inside. This is especially useful for things such as the party room, where you can charge people an entry fee to enter the party room.

So, let’s begin the list of the properties. Here we go!

oAgGvqh.png818×529

Location: Lumbridge Swamp
Price: 50k

J2MaFRo.png691×391

Location: Lumbridge Swamp
Price: 60k

Location: Rimmington
Price: 100k


Yes, even the grain place.

Location: Draynor-Lumbridge border
Price: 500k

Location: Draynor
Price: 50k

Location: Falador
Price: 20k

Location: Falador
Price: 300k

Location: Falador
Price: 2M

Location: Falador
Price: 5M
Read about castles to find the specialty of getting one!

Location: Edgeville-Varrock Border
Price: 80k

More to be mentioned!

Read full topic
